name: Fire Brick
description: A heat-resistant brick ideal for fireplaces and furnaces.

name: Dutch Brick
description: A stylish, durable brick often used for decorative purposes.

name: Engineering Bricks
description: Highly durable bricks known for their strength and water resistance.

name: Hollow Bricks
description: Lightweight bricks with hollow cores for insulation.

name: Cream City Brick
description: A unique cream-colored brick commonly used in historic buildings.

name: Burnt Clay Brick
description: Traditional clay bricks known for their strength and affordability.

name: Acid Brick
description: Bricks resistant to acids, used in industrial settings.

name: Sand Lime Brick
description: Bricks made of sand and lime, offering smooth finishes.

name: Jhama Brick
description: A hard, reddish brick often used for construction in India.

name: Concrete Brick
description: Durable bricks made of concrete for structural use.

name: London Stock Brick
description: Historic yellow bricks seen in London architecture.

name: Sun Dried Brick
description: Eco-friendly bricks dried naturally by the sun.

name: Lakhori Brick
description: Small, thin bricks used in traditional Mughal architecture.

name: Nanak Shahi Bricks
description: Bricks used in historical Sikh architecture for their aesthetic appeal.

name: Porotherm Smart Bricks
description: Eco-friendly bricks designed for energy efficiency.

name: Fly Ash Brick
description: Made from fly ash, offering eco-friendly and durable properties.
